meanings.definition: To compare or represent as similar
meanings.sent1: She likens her cat to a tiger when it pounces on its toy.
meanings.sent2: He often likens his favorite sports team to a group of warriors.
meanings.sent3: The way she likens her messy room to a jungle is quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: His storytelling likens the power of words to a magical spell.
meanings.sent5: The artist likens the colors in her painting to a beautiful sunset.

meanings.definition: To draw a comparison between two things
meanings.sent1: The author likens the protagonist to a brave knight on a quest.
meanings.sent2: The teacher likens learning a new language to exploring a new world.
meanings.sent3: His joke that likens broccoli to tiny trees always makes me smile.
meanings.sent4: The poet likens love to a gentle breeze that touches the soul.
meanings.sent5: The scientist likens the process to solving a complex puzzle.
